verbs.description: Jim Acosta [V: is] accusing conservative media outlets of misrepresenting his words in order to make it seem like he said disparaging comments specifically directed at President Trump 's base .

[ARG0: Jim Acosta] is [V: accusing] [ARG1: conservative media outlets] [ARG2: of misrepresenting his words in order to make it seem like he said disparaging comments specifically directed at President Trump 's base] .

Jim Acosta is accusing [ARG0: conservative media outlets] of [V: misrepresenting] [ARG1: his words] [ARGM-PRP: in order to make it seem like he said disparaging comments specifically directed at President Trump 's base] .

Jim Acosta is accusing [ARG0: conservative media outlets] of misrepresenting his words in order to [V: make] [ARG1: it seem like he said disparaging comments specifically directed at President Trump 's base] .

Jim Acosta is accusing conservative media outlets of misrepresenting his words in order to make it [V: seem] [ARG1: like he said disparaging comments specifically directed at President Trump 's base] .

Jim Acosta is accusing conservative media outlets of misrepresenting his words in order to make it seem like [ARG0: he] [V: said] [ARG1: disparaging comments specifically directed at President Trump 's base] .

Jim Acosta is accusing conservative media outlets of misrepresenting his words in order to make it seem like he said [V: disparaging] [ARG1: comments] specifically directed at President Trump 's base .

Jim Acosta is accusing conservative media outlets of misrepresenting his words in order to make it seem like he said [ARG1: disparaging comments] [ARGM-MNR: specifically] [V: directed] [ARG2: at President Trump 's base] .
